name: Balboa / Plague Sermon - Split Record [Translucent Brown 12" Vinyl]
description:
Magic Bullet Records (USA) and Midmarch Records (UK) present a cross atlantic split release between two of heavy musics greatest kept secrets, Philadelphia's Balboa and Brighton based Plague Sermon. Balboa follow split releases with Rosetta (Level-Plane) and Aussitot Mort (Forge Again) and bring you their most accomplished chaotic hardcore to date, that would appeal to fans of Majority Rule, Cursed and Young Widows. Plague Sermon have taken half a stride out of their screamo past, and bring forth 15 minutes of at times apocalyptic, and at times frantic, post metal that would appeal to lovers of Boris, Drowning with our Anchors and City of Caterpillar. The vinyl release is beautifully presented with artwork from Richard Forbes-Hamilton, who has taken care of art for ASVA, and limited to 330 copies on Translucent Brown Vinyl.

Track Listing

Boys in the Creeks
Muerto Por Eleccion
Bury the Lies
State of Exception
We are Both Drowning
The Doves Fly North, The City is Forsaken

name: Plague Sermon / Dying in Motion / Heads and Heads / Virginia on Duty - Four Way Split Vinyl
description:
A year in the making, here is the horribly overdue split featuring multiple bands from multiple labels in a giant collaborative effort to put out this twelve inch vinyl. The split features new tracks from Dying in Motion (Switzerland), Heads and Heads (Spain), Virginia on Duty (Malaysia), and The Plague Sermon (United Kingdom). A meeting of some of the best emo (or call it screamo) bands from around the globe. Just a wonderful thing to document the network and get friendship pressed on piece of plastic.

Track Listing

A1- Dying in Motion - Tiefenrausch
A2- Dying in Motion - Katakomben der Seele
A3- Heads and Heads - Llamas Eternas
A4- Heads and Heads - Interludio
A5- Heads and Heads - Visiones
B1- The Plague Sermon - You Are My Beating Heart
B2- Virginia On Duty - Hatred That Always Grow
B3- Virginia On Duty - Half-Young Portrait
B4- Virginia On Duty - 5th Victory

http://www.myspace.com/theplaguesermon

name: Oxbow - Lover Ungrateful
description: Designed to be the last will and testament of failed humanity, ladies and gentleman, I give you Oxbow. Quite possibly the most important band in the world right now, something that Eugene Robinson, Dan Adams, Greg Davis and Niko Wenner have been Fighting for some 20 years. Veterans of the world they have played all over; Oxbow now bring you 'Lover Ungrateful', a 7" record containing two of the best songs from the great history of this influential band. From 2002's An Evil Heat (Neurot) is 'Stallkicker' and from 2007's The Narcotic Story (Hydrahead) is 'Frankly Frank', both new recordings, using acoustic instruments only, these are harrowing versions of two classics, that make you feel right next to the band, a place for the brave, but one of the most rewarding on this planet.

name: Balboa / Plague Sermon - Split Tape
description:
Tape (Cassette) Version of the Split Record between Brighton's 'Plague Sermon' and Philly's 'Balboa'. 

Released on Utarid Tapes. 
http://www.myspace.com/utarid.tapes

Track Listing

Boys in the Creeks
Muerto Por Eleccion
Bury the Lies
State of Exception
We are Both Drowning
The Doves Fly North, The City is Forsaken

name: The Plague Sermon / The Grizzly Twister - Split
description:
Limited to 300 copies on white vinyl. A split 7" effort between Sweden's The Grizzly Twister and England's The Plague Sermon. The Plague Sermon bring engulfing waves of epic but brutal screamo, and the Grizzly Twister step up to the plate with their brand of Blip-Blip hardcore, somewhere in-between disco and the soundtrack to the end of the world. It's all yours! Welcome to discotheque Armageddon we dare you to dance.

Sigmar
Lets take a Swim in Lake You
With Love Sincerely Yours, The Enemy
Mi Abogado Espanoel
This City is a Halo
